Jesus’s apostles asked about when they would know the end was near. Jesus responded, “The due time is near.’ Do not go after them. Furthermore, when you hear of wars and disturbances, do not be terrified. For these things must take place first, but the end will not occur immediately.” Then he said to them: “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be great earthquakes, and in one place after another food shortages and pestilences; and there will be fearful sights and from heaven great signs” There are a couple points we can draw here! Only Jehovah, God knows the exact date and time. However, the Bible does describes “signs” that would hint the tribulation period is near. How many are we seeing today? Wars and disturbances, earthquakes, food shortages, pestilences (aka illnesses/pandemics), & fearful sights. — We turn on the news and see a combination of these on a daily basis. Should we be afraid? Granted some truly scary, horrific things are happening, but as Jesus mentioned, these things have to happen. We have to be patient, the end won’t be coming right away, but it’s on the horizons. Now is the time to draw close to God. Stay safe, and for more info you can message me or check out the website linked in my profile! Kindly, Izzie

No, not yet. The tribulation begins with the political powers turning on the world’s false religions, which obviously has not begun. It is hard to imagine that could possibly happen since the political powers are so influenced by the predominant religions of their countries. But this is typical of Jehovah’s major prophecies. He almost never foretells things which look likely to happen, he often foretells things no one believe could possibly happen. So that when those prophecies were fulfilled everyone would know that only the all-powerful God could have made it happen. Yes, but I would never take the apocalyptical texts (such as Daniel’s prophesies) literally. This was the mistake the Jewish scholars and clerics made that led them to reject Jesus. In reality, we have been in the promised period since the mid 1800s. We have seen knowledge increase, greater wars, the development of devastating weapons of war, kingship falling and rapid changes in nations and declines in empires, and increasing travel and communication (lightning traveling across the earth). However, it is not at all as people in Christianity (and Judaism or Islam) who believe in apocalyptic events have literally understood such things. Some elements of the story really relate to much earlier periods in time as well. Also, I would not assume literal interpretations or that these fantastical events will occur within a relatively short period of time. A Day ofGod can be a millenium (a thousand years on earth). The book of Revelation has many different interpretations, and it’s not at all widely agreed that there IS a Tribulation period at all. In some interpretations, the Tribulation already happened, and was the persecution of the early church. See Great Tribulation - Wikipedia. If you’re talking about the pandemic, I don’t think it’s nearly bad enough to count. It’s nowhere near as bad as the Black Death, for instance.
